DOC.brief_summary: University Reproductive Associates is conducting a pilot study to study the technique of egg freezing. Your participation in this study will provide us with important information to allow us to offer this technology for women wishing to freeze their eggs before cancer treatments. Your participation will include a standard IVF cycle with your eggs being frozen for a brief period of time and then transferred back to you as usual. You will receive a significant reduction in your IVF cycle cost.
DOC.criteria: 1. 10 women between the ages of 1835 inclusive at time of signing Informed Consent Form. 2. In good general health off of current medications which may confound response to study medications. 3. Desire to seek pregnancy actively during the study period by IVFICSI. 4. A normal uterine cavity must have been confirmed by either hydrosonogram or hysteroscopy within two years of entering the study. 5. Ability to use the required medications. 6. Day 3 FSH level < 12 IU/ml 1. Current pregnancy 2. Patients with significant anemia (Hemoglobin < 10 mg/dL). 3. Patients enrolled simultaneously into other investigative studies that would interfere with this research study.
